sen.e: Nagataka SAGARA (male, 1492 to June 25, 1526) was the second son of Nagatsune SAGARA, the thirteenth head of the SAGARA family.

sen.e: Nagataka SAGARA became a Buddhism priest at the age of ten with a pen name, Zuiken and entered the priesthood at Tofuku-ji temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 1524年、弟の長祗が相良長定に攻められて翌年に自殺すると、1526年に僧兵をかき集めて長定を破り、還俗して太郎長隆と名乗って相良氏の家督を継ごうとしたが、僧上がりの長隆に対して相良一族や家臣団は従おうとせず、長隆は正式に家督を継ぐこともできず、人吉城から逃亡し、永里城に入った。
sen.e: When Nagataka SAGARA's younger brother, Nagamasa was attacked by Nagasada SAGARA in 1524 and Nagamasa killed himself in the next year, Nagataka raked up the monk soldiers and, with them, beat down Nagasada in 1526 and, then, Nagataka returned to the secular life naming himself Taro-Nagataka and tried to succeed to the headship of the SAGARA family, however, the whole SAGARA family and their vassal groups would not obey Nagataka who had been a priest, and Nagataka could not formally succeed to the headship of the family, ran away from Hitoyoshi-jo castle, and went into Nagasato-jo castle.

sen.j: その後、一族の実力者上村頼興の後援を得た実兄の相良義滋に攻められて、自害に追い込まれた。
sen.e: After that, Nagataka was attacked by his elder brother by blood, Yoshishige SAGARA who was backed up by an influential person of the SAGARA family, Yoriyoshi UEMURA, and Nagataka was driven to kill himself.
